title: Bug 3622: New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
description: Bug 3622: New Package Wizard has a confusing message (1GD0L9O)
OB: When the 'New Java Package' wizard is invoked and no text is entered in the package name field, a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. The user is unsure of the meaning of this message and whether it indicates an error.
EB: When the 'New Java Package' wizard is invoked and no text is entered in the package name field, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not be displayed. This message has caused confusion among users and should be removed.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new Java project. 2. Select the project. 3. Open the 'New Java Package' wizard.
